subject: Sales
title: The Seven-Second Judgment
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Seven-Second Judgment.

hook.text: Seven seconds. That's all a buyer needs to decide whether to trust you or tune you out.

buildup.text: Princeton researchers proved snap judgments form almost instantly and rarely reverse.

discovery.text: It's not your words. It's posture, tone, and whether your smile reaches your eyes.

twist.text: Buyers don't know they've judged you. They just feel something is off, or right.

climax.text: You can't rehearse authenticity. But you can show up prepared, calm, and genuinely curious.

punchline.text: Trust is won or lost before your first sentence ends.

quiz.question: How quickly do people form trust judgments?
